newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Mid-Atlantic power drops on gas, mild temps.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Mid-Atlantic power drops on gas, mild temps.

text.p: Spot bulk electricity prices in the Mid-Atlantic U.S. dropped Thursday, continuing a recent decline with natural gas on forecast of mild temperatures in the region through this weekend.
"Mild weather, and gas came off hard. Load was predicted to be low for Friday," said an East Coast broker.

The latest forecast indicated Friday's temperatures would climb four to seven degrees Fahrenheit above normal with readings mostly in the 30s-40s. Then, temperatures would rise further at eight to 12 degrees above seasonal norm Sunday. But readings would turn sharply lower Monday at six to 10 degrees below normal.
NYMEX February Henry Hub natgas futures were last down 34.5 cents at $3.421 per million British thermal units.

Friday electricity for firm, peak delivery in the Pennsylvania-New Jersey-Maryland (PJM) Interconnect pool plummeted to $17.50-$18.50 a megawatt hour (MWh), down from Tuesday's day-ahead prices at $18.50-$20.00.
There was almost no bulk power trading Wednesday due to the Christmas holiday.
Firm, off-peak PJM power for Friday delivery held steady at $14.00-$15.00.
January 1997 PJM electricity with similar delivery terms were discussed at $30.20-$30.50.
PJM power deliveries for January and February slipped to $29.75-$30.00 from Tuesday's $30.35-$30.65.
March PJM electricity fell 25 cents to $25.00-$25.25 from Tuesday's $25.25-$25.50.
First-quarter PJM deliveries were talked at $28.30-$28.50, and second-quarter quotes were assessed at $23.20-$23.40, a slightly tighter range than Tuesday's $23.15-$23.50.
July/August PJM prices were pegged at $31.70-$31.90, down from Tuesday's $31.80-$32.10.
Third-quarter PJM power were still valued at 29.00-$29.25, fourth-quarter 1997 $24.00-$24.50 and calendar 1997 for peak hour delivery $26.40-$26.70.
PECO Energy said its 1,055 megawatt (MW) Limerick unit 2 returned on line today after its restart was interrupted Wednesday due to a turbine vibration problem.
